intro: Tutcheria microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited tutcheria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to lavender flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Tutcheria microcarpa is a perennial herb that is often found in swampy or marshy habitats.
